- Location: Facade, southern corner
- Date: Uncertain, probably Vespasian
- [Hieroglyphic Text](https://www.ifao.egnet.net/uploads/publications/enligne/Temples-Esna002.pdf#page=185){target="_blank"}
- Bibliography: @klotz-baboons, pp. 38-40

<div class="col2">

| *[...] ḥr [...]=f*  
| *tȝ-[sn].t pw *  
|    *tỉs=f ḏ.t=f ỉm=f *  
|    *smn=f snṯ nb*  
|        *m ḥry-wḏḥw* 
|
| *s[.t nt nḥỉ] ms.w m-ḫnt=s*  
|    *ṯnỉ šȝy [ḥr msḫn.t...]*  
|
| *[...twt] mȝȝ sw r (dỉ)-mr.t*
|   *ẖr Rʿ [...]*  
| *ʿ ỉm=s ḥr sḥḏ tȝ.wy* 
|
| [...] on [...] it,
| it is E[sn]a, 
|     in which he reposes his body,  
|     and sets up every foundation 
|         as Chief of the Altar.
|  
| The pla[ce of beseech]ing children is within it,  
|     and distinguishing fate [upon the birthbrick...]
|  
| [...] it is more perfect to see than the sky 
|     bearing Re,
| the moon within it lighting up the two lands.
